src/QueryPath/CssEventHandler.php
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 <?php
00002 /** @file
00003  * This file contains a full implementation of the CssEventHandler interface.
00004  * 
00005  * The tools in this package initiate a CSS selector parsing routine and then
00006  * handle all of the callbacks.
00007  *
00008  * The implementation provided herein adheres to the CSS 3 Selector specification
00009  * with the following caveats:
00010  *
00011  *  - The negation (:not()) and containment (:has()) pseudo-classes allow *full* 
00012  *    selectors and not just simple selectors.
00013  *  - There are a variety of additional pseudo-classes supported by this 
00014  *    implementation that are not part of the spec. Most of the jQuery 
00015  *    pseudo-classes are supported. The :x-root pseudo-class is also supported.
00016  *  - Pseudo-classes that require a User Agent to function have been disabled.
00017  *    Thus there is no :hover pseudo-class.
00018  *  - All pseudo-elements require the double-colon (::) notation. This breaks 
00019  *    backward compatibility with the 2.1 spec, but it makes visible the issue
00020  *    that pseudo-elements cannot be effectively used with most of the present 
00021  *    library. They return <b>stdClass objects with a text property</b> (QP > 1.3)
00022  *    instead of elements.
00023  *  - The pseudo-classes first-of-type, nth-of-type and last-of-type may or may
00024  *    not conform to the specification. The spec is unclear.
00025  *  - pseudo-class filters of the form -an+b do not function as described in the
00026  *    specification. However, they do behave the same way here as they do in 
00027  *    jQuery.
00028  *  - This library DOES provide XML namespace aware tools. Selectors can use
00029  *    namespaces to increase specificity.
00030  *  - This library does nothing with the CSS 3 Selector specificity rating. Of 
00031  *    course specificity is preserved (to the best of our abilities), but there
00032  *    is no calculation done.
00033  *
00034  * For detailed examples of how the code works and what selectors are supported,
00035  * see the CssEventTests file, which contains the unit tests used for
00036  * testing this implementation.
00037  *
00038  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00039  * @license http://opensource.org/licenses/lgpl-2.1.php LGPL (The GNU Lesser GPL) or an MIT-like license.
00040  */
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Require the parser library.
00044  */
00045 require_once 'CssParser.php';
00046 
00047 /**
00048  * Handler that tracks progress of a query through a DOM.
00049  *
00050  * The main idea is that we keep a copy of the tree, and then use an
00051  * array to keep track of matches. To handle a list of selectors (using
00052  * the comma separator), we have to track both the currently progressing
00053  * match and the previously matched elements.
00054  *
00055  * To use this handler:
00056  * @code
00057  * $filter = '#id'; // Some CSS selector
00058  * $handler = new QueryPathCssParser(DOMNode $dom);
00059  * $parser = new CssParser();
00060  * $parser->parse($filter, $handler);
00061  * $matches = $handler->getMatches();
00062  * @endcode
00063  *
00064  * $matches will be an array of zero or more DOMElement objects.
00065  *
00066  * @ingroup querypath_css
00067  */
00068 class QueryPathCssEventHandler implements CssEventHandler {
00069   protected $dom = NULL; // Always points to the top level.
00070   protected $matches = NULL; // The matches
00071   protected $alreadyMatched = NULL; // Matches found before current selector.
00072   protected $findAnyElement = TRUE;
00073   
00074   
00075   /**
00076    * Create a new event handler.
00077    */
00078   public function __construct($dom) {
00079     $this->alreadyMatched = new SplObjectStorage();
00080     $matches = new SplObjectStorage();
00081     
00082     // Array of DOMElements
00083     if (is_array($dom) || $dom instanceof SplObjectStorage) {
00084       //$matches = array();
00085       foreach($dom as $item) {
00086         if ($item instanceof DOMNode && $item->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
00087           //$matches[] = $item;
00088           $matches->attach($item);
00089         }
00090       }
00091       //$this->dom = count($matches) > 0 ? $matches[0] : NULL;
00092       if ($matches->count() > 0) {
00093         $matches->rewind();
00094         $this->dom = $matches->current();
00095       }
00096       else {
00097         //throw new Exception("Setting DOM to Null");
00098         $this->dom = NULL;
00099       }
00100       $this->matches = $matches;
00101     }
00102     // DOM Document -- we get the root element.
00103     elseif ($dom instanceof DOMDocument) {
00104       $this->dom = $dom->documentElement;
00105       $matches->attach($dom->documentElement);
00106     }
00107     // DOM Element -- we use this directly
00108     elseif ($dom instanceof DOMElement) {
00109       $this->dom = $dom;
00110       $matches->attach($dom);
00111     }
00112     // NodeList -- We turn this into an array
00113     elseif ($dom instanceof DOMNodeList) {
00114       $a = array(); // Not sure why we are doing this....
00115       foreach ($dom as $item) {
00116         if ($item->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
00117           $matches->attach($item);
00118           $a[] = $item; 
00119         }
00120       }
00121       $this->dom = $a;
00122     }
00123     // FIXME: Handle SimpleXML!
00124     // Uh-oh... we don't support anything else.
00125     else {
00126       throw new Exception("Unhandled type: " . get_class($dom));
00127     }
00128     $this->matches = $matches;
00129   }
00130   
00131   /**
00132    * Generic finding method.
00133    *
00134    * This is the primary searching method used throughout QueryPath.
00135    *
00136    * @param string $filter
00137    *  A valid CSS 3 filter.
00138    * @return QueryPathCssEventHandler
00139    *  Returns itself.
00140    */
00141   public function find($filter) {
00142     $parser = new CssParser($filter, $this);
00143     $parser->parse();
00144     return $this;
00145   }
00146   
00147   /**
00148    * Get the elements that match the evaluated selector.
00149    *
00150    * This should be called after the filter has been parsed.
00151    *
00152    * @return array
00153    *  The matched items. This is almost always an array of 
00154    *  {@link DOMElement} objects. It is always an instance of
00155    *  {@link DOMNode} objects.
00156    */
00157   public function getMatches() {
00158     //$result = array_merge($this->alreadyMatched, $this->matches);
00159     $result = new SplObjectStorage();
00160     foreach($this->alreadyMatched as $m) $result->attach($m);
00161     foreach($this->matches as $m) $result->attach($m);
00162     return $result;
00163   }
00164   
00165   /**
00166    * Find any element with the ID that matches $id.
00167    *
00168    * If this finds an ID, it will immediately quit. Essentially, it doesn't
00169    * enforce ID uniqueness, but it assumes it.
00170    *
00171    * @param $id
00172    *  String ID for an element.
00173    */
00174   public function elementID($id) {
00175     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00176     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00177     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00178       // Check if any of the current items has the desired ID.
00179       if ($item->hasAttribute('id') && $item->getAttribute('id') === $id) {
00180         $found->attach($item);
00181         break;
00182       }
00183     }
00184     $this->matches = $found;
00185     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00186   }
00187   
00188   // Inherited
00189   public function element($name) {
00190     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00191     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00192     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00193     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00194       // Should the existing item be included?
00195       // In some cases (e.g. element is root element)
00196       // it definitely should. But what about other cases?
00197       if ($item->tagName == $name) {
00198         $found->attach($item);
00199       }
00200       // Search for matching kids.
00201       //$nl = $item->getElementsByTagName($name);
00202       //$found = array_merge($found, $this->nodeListToArray($nl));
00203     }
00204     
00205     $this->matches = $found;
00206   }
00207   
00208   // Inherited
00209   public function elementNS($lname, $namespace = NULL) {
00210     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00211     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00212     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00213     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00214       // Looking up NS URI only works if the XMLNS attributes are declared
00215       // at a level equal to or above the searching doc. Normalizing a doc
00216       // should fix this, but it doesn't. So we have to use a fallback 
00217       // detection scheme which basically searches by lname and then 
00218       // does a post hoc check on the tagname.
00219       
00220       //$nsuri = $item->lookupNamespaceURI($namespace);
00221       $nsuri = $this->dom->lookupNamespaceURI($namespace);
00222       
00223       // XXX: Presumably the base item needs to be checked. Spec isn't
00224       // too clear, but there are three possibilities:
00225       // - base should always be checked (what we do here)
00226       // - base should never be checked (only children)
00227       // - base should only be checked if it is the root node
00228       if ($item instanceof DOMNode 
00229           && $item->namespaceURI == $nsuri 
00230           && $lname == $item->localName) {
00231         $found->attach($item);
00232       }
00233       
00234       if (!empty($nsuri)) {
00235         $nl = $item->getElementsByTagNameNS($nsuri, $lname);
00236         // If something is found, merge them:
00237         //if (!empty($nl)) $found = array_merge($found, $this->nodeListToArray($nl));
00238         if (!empty($nl)) $this->attachNodeList($nl, $found);
00239       }
00240       else {
00241         //$nl = $item->getElementsByTagName($namespace . ':' . $lname);
00242         $nl = $item->getElementsByTagName($lname);
00243         $tagname = $namespace . ':' . $lname;
00244         $nsmatches = array();
00245         foreach ($nl as $node) {
00246           if ($node->tagName == $tagname) {
00247             //$nsmatches[] = $node;
00248             $found->attach($node);
00249           }
00250         }
00251         // If something is found, merge them:
00252         //if (!empty($nsmatches)) $found = array_merge($found, $nsmatches);
00253       }
00254     }
00255     $this->matches = $found;
00256   }
00257   
00258   public function anyElement() {
00259     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00260     //$this->findAnyElement = TRUE;
00261     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00262     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00263       $found->attach($item); // Add self
00264       // See issue #20 or section 6.2 of this:
00265       // http://www.w3.org/TR/2009/PR-css3-selectors-20091215/#universal-selector
00266       //$nl = $item->getElementsByTagName('*');
00267       //$this->attachNodeList($nl, $found);
00268     }
00269     
00270     $this->matches = $found;
00271     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00272   }
00273   public function anyElementInNS($ns) {
00274     //$this->findAnyElement = TRUE;
00275     $nsuri = $this->dom->lookupNamespaceURI($ns);
00276     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00277     if (!empty($nsuri)) {
00278       $matches = $this->candidateList();
00279       foreach ($matches as $item) {
00280         if ($item instanceOf DOMNode && $nsuri == $item->namespaceURI) {
00281           $found->attach($item);
00282         }
00283       }
00284     }
00285     $this->matches = $found;//UniqueElementList::get($found);
00286     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00287   }
00288   public function elementClass($name) {
00289     
00290     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00291     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00292     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00293       if ($item->hasAttribute('class')) {
00294         $classes = explode(' ', $item->getAttribute('class'));
00295         if (in_array($name, $classes)) $found->attach($item);
00296       }
00297     }
00298     
00299     $this->matches = $found;//UniqueElementList::get($found);
00300     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00301   }
00302   
00303   public function attribute($name, $value = NULL, $operation = CssEventHandler::isExactly) {
00304     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00305     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00306     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00307       if ($item->hasAttribute($name)) {
00308         if (isset($value)) {
00309           // If a value exists, then we need a match.
00310           if($this->attrValMatches($value, $item->getAttribute($name), $operation)) {
00311             $found->attach($item);
00312           }
00313         }
00314         else {
00315           // If no value exists, then we consider it a match.
00316           $found->attach($item);
00317         }
00318       }
00319     }
00320     $this->matches = $found; //UniqueElementList::get($found);
00321     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00322   }
00323 
00324   /**
00325    * Helper function to find all elements with exact matches.
00326    * 
00327    * @deprecated All use cases seem to be covered by attribute().
00328    */
00329   protected function searchForAttr($name, $value = NULL) {
00330     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00331     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00332     foreach ($matches as $candidate) {
00333       if ($candidate->hasAttribute($name)) {
00334         // If value is required, match that, too.
00335         if (isset($value) && $value == $candidate->getAttribute($name)) {
00336           $found->attach($candidate);
00337         }
00338         // Otherwise, it's a match on name alone.
00339         else {
00340           $found->attach($candidate);
00341         }
00342       }
00343     }
00344     
00345     $this->matches = $found;
00346   }
00347   
00348   public function attributeNS($lname, $ns, $value = NULL, $operation = CssEventHandler::isExactly) {
00349     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00350     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00351     if (count($matches) == 0) {
00352       $this->matches = $found;
00353       return;
00354     }
00355     
00356     // Get the namespace URI for the given label.
00357     //$uri = $matches[0]->lookupNamespaceURI($ns);
00358     $matches->rewind();
00359     $e = $matches->current();
00360     $uri = $e->lookupNamespaceURI($ns);
00361     
00362     foreach ($matches as $item) {
00363       //foreach ($item->attributes as $attr) {
00364       //  print "$attr->prefix:$attr->localName ($attr->namespaceURI), Value: $attr->nodeValue\n";
00365       //}
00366       if ($item->hasAttributeNS($uri, $lname)) {
00367         if (isset($value)) {
00368           if ($this->attrValMatches($value, $item->getAttributeNS($uri, $lname), $operation)) {
00369             $found->attach($item);
00370           }
00371         }
00372         else {
00373           $found->attach($item);
00374         }
00375       }
00376     }
00377     $this->matches = $found;
00378     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00379   }
00380   
00381   /**
00382    * This also supports the following nonstandard pseudo classes:
00383    *  - :x-reset/:x-root (reset to the main item passed into the constructor. Less drastic than :root)
00384    *  - :odd/:even (shorthand for :nth-child(odd)/:nth-child(even))
00385    */
00386   public function pseudoClass($name, $value = NULL) {
00387     $name = strtolower($name);
00388     // Need to handle known pseudoclasses.
00389     switch($name) {
00390       case 'visited':
00391       case 'hover':
00392       case 'active':
00393       case 'focus':
00394       case 'animated': //  Last 3 are from jQuery
00395       case 'visible':
00396       case 'hidden':
00397         // These require a UA, which we don't have.
00398       case 'target':
00399         // This requires a location URL, which we don't have.
00400         $this->matches = new SplObjectStorage();
00401         break;
00402       case 'indeterminate':
00403         // The assumption is that there is a UA and the format is HTML.
00404         // I don't know if this should is useful without a UA.
00405         throw new NotImplementedException(":indeterminate is not implemented.");
00406         break;
00407       case 'lang':
00408         // No value = exception.
00409         if (!isset($value)) {
00410           throw new NotImplementedException("No handler for lang pseudoclass without value.");
00411         }
00412         $this->lang($value);
00413         break;
00414       case 'link':
00415         $this->searchForAttr('href');
00416         break;
00417       case 'root':
00418         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00419         if (empty($this->dom)) {
00420           $this->matches = $found;
00421         }
00422         elseif (is_array($this->dom)) {
00423           $found->attach($this->dom[0]->ownerDocument->documentElement);
00424           $this->matches = $found;
00425         }
00426         elseif ($this->dom instanceof DOMNode) {
00427           $found->attach($this->dom->ownerDocument->documentElement);
00428           $this->matches = $found;
00429         }
00430         elseif ($this->dom instanceof DOMNodeList && $this->dom->length > 0) {
00431           $found->attach($this->dom->item(0)->ownerDocument->documentElement);
00432           $this->matches = $found;
00433         }
00434         else {
00435           // Hopefully we never get here:
00436           $found->attach($this->dom);
00437           $this->matches = $found;
00438         }
00439         break;
00440       
00441       // NON-STANDARD extensions for reseting to the "top" items set in
00442       // the constructor.  
00443       case 'x-root':
00444       case 'x-reset':
00445         $this->matches = new SplObjectStorage();
00446         $this->matches->attach($this->dom);
00447         break;        
00448       
00449       // NON-STANDARD extensions for simple support of even and odd. These
00450       // are supported by jQuery, FF, and other user agents.  
00451       case 'even':
00452         $this->nthChild(2, 0);
00453         break;
00454       case 'odd':
00455         $this->nthChild(2, 1);
00456         break;
00457       
00458       // Standard child-checking items.  
00459       case 'nth-child':
00460         list($aVal, $bVal) = $this->parseAnB($value);
00461         $this->nthChild($aVal, $bVal);
00462         break;
00463       case 'nth-last-child':
00464         list($aVal, $bVal) = $this->parseAnB($value);
00465         $this->nthLastChild($aVal, $bVal);
00466         break;
00467       case 'nth-of-type':
00468         list($aVal, $bVal) = $this->parseAnB($value);
00469         $this->nthOfTypeChild($aVal, $bVal, FALSE);
00470         break;
00471       case 'nth-last-of-type':
00472         list($aVal, $bVal) = $this->parseAnB($value);
00473         $this->nthLastOfTypeChild($aVal, $bVal);
00474         break;
00475       case 'first-child':
00476         $this->nthChild(0, 1);
00477         break;
00478       case 'last-child':
00479         $this->nthLastChild(0, 1);
00480         break;
00481       case 'first-of-type':
00482         $this->firstOfType();
00483         break;
00484       case 'last-of-type':
00485         $this->lastOfType();
00486         break;
00487       case 'only-child':
00488         $this->onlyChild();
00489         break;
00490       case 'only-of-type':
00491         $this->onlyOfType();
00492         break;
00493       case 'empty':
00494         $this->emptyElement();
00495         break;  
00496       case 'not':
00497         if (empty($value)) {
00498           throw new CssParseException(":not() requires a value.");
00499         }
00500         $this->not($value);
00501         break;
00502       // Additional pseudo-classes defined in jQuery:
00503       case 'lt':
00504       case 'gt':
00505       case 'nth':
00506       case 'eq':
00507       case 'first':
00508       case 'last':
00509       //case 'even':
00510       //case 'odd':
00511         $this->getByPosition($name, $value);  
00512         break;
00513       case 'parent':
00514         $matches = $this->candidateList();
00515         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00516         foreach ($matches as $match) {
00517           if (!empty($match->firstChild)) {
00518             $found->attach($match);
00519           }
00520         }
00521         $this->matches = $found;
00522         break;
00523       
00524       case 'enabled':  
00525       case 'disabled':  
00526       case 'checked':  
00527         $this->attribute($name);
00528         break;
00529       case 'text':
00530       case 'radio':
00531       case 'checkbox':
00532       case 'file':
00533       case 'password':
00534       case 'submit':
00535       case 'image':
00536       case 'reset':
00537       case 'button':
00538         $this->attribute('type', $name);
00539         break;
00540 
00541       case 'header':
00542         $matches = $this->candidateList();
00543         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00544         foreach ($matches as $item) {
00545           $tag = $item->tagName;
00546           $f = strtolower(substr($tag, 0, 1));
00547           if ($f == 'h' && strlen($tag) == 2 && ctype_digit(substr($tag, 1, 1))) {
00548             $found->attach($item);
00549           }
00550         }
00551         $this->matches = $found;
00552         break;
00553       case 'has':
00554         $this->has($value);
00555         break;
00556       // Contains == text matches.
00557       // In QP 2.1, this was changed.
00558       case 'contains':
00559         $value = $this->removeQuotes($value);
00560     
00561         $matches = $this->candidateList();
00562         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00563         foreach ($matches as $item) {
00564           if (strpos($item->textContent, $value) !== FALSE) {
00565             $found->attach($item);
00566           }
00567         }
00568         $this->matches = $found;
00569         break;
00570         
00571       // Since QP 2.1
00572       case 'contains-exactly':
00573         $value = $this->removeQuotes($value);
00574       
00575         $matches = $this->candidateList();
00576         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00577         foreach ($matches as $item) {
00578           if ($item->textContent == $value) {
00579             $found->attach($item);
00580           }
00581         }
00582         $this->matches = $found;
00583         break;
00584       default:
00585         throw new CssParseException("Unknown Pseudo-Class: " . $name);
00586     }
00587     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
00588   }
00589   
00590   /**
00591    * Remove leading and trailing quotes.
00592    */
00593   private function removeQuotes($str) {
00594     $f = substr($str, 0, 1);
00595     $l = substr($str, -1);
00596     if ($f === $l && ($f == '"' || $f == "'")) {
00597       $str = substr($str, 1, -1);
00598     }
00599     return $str;
00600   }
00601   
00602   /**
00603    * Pseudo-class handler for a variety of jQuery pseudo-classes.
00604    * Handles lt, gt, eq, nth, first, last pseudo-classes.
00605    */
00606   private function getByPosition($operator, $pos) {
00607     $matches = $this->candidateList();
00608     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
00609     if ($matches->count() == 0) {
00610       return;
00611     }
00612     
00613     switch ($operator) {
00614       case 'nth':
00615       case 'eq':
00616         if ($matches->count() >= $pos) {
00617           //$found[] = $matches[$pos -1];
00618           foreach ($matches as $match) {
00619             // CSS is 1-based, so we pre-increment.
00620             if ($matches->key() + 1 == $pos) {
00621               $found->attach($match);
00622               break;
00623             }
00624           }
00625         }
00626         break;
00627       case 'first':
00628         if ($matches->count() > 0) {
00629           $matches->rewind(); // This is necessary to init.
00630           $found->attach($matches->current());
00631         }
00632         break;
00633       case 'last':
00634         if ($matches->count() > 0) {
00635           
00636           // Spin through iterator.
00637           foreach ($matches as $item) {};
00638          
00639           $found->attach($item);
00640         }
00641         break;
00642       // case 'even': 
00643       //         for ($i = 1; $i <= count($matches); ++$i) {
00644       //           if ($i % 2 == 0) {
00645       //             $found[] = $matches[$i];
00646       //           }
00647       //         }
00648       //         break;
00649       //       case 'odd':
00650       //         for ($i = 1; $i <= count($matches); ++$i) {
00651       //           if ($i % 2 == 0) {
00652       //             $found[] = $matches[$i];
00653       //           }
00654       //         }
00655       //         break;
00656       case 'lt':
00657         $i = 0;
00658         foreach ($matches as $item) {
00659           if (++$i < $pos) {
00660             $found->attach($item);
00661           }
00662         }
00663         break;
00664       case 'gt':
00665         $i = 0;
00666         foreach ($matches as $item) {
00667           if (++$i > $pos) {
00668             $found->attach($item);
00669           }
00670         }
00671         break;
00672     }
00673     
00674     $this->matches = $found;
00675   }
00676   
00677   /**
00678    * Parse an an+b rule for CSS pseudo-classes.
00679    * @param $rule
00680    *  Some rule in the an+b format.
00681    * @return 
00682    *  Array (list($aVal, $bVal)) of the two values.
00683    * @throws CssParseException
00684    *  If the rule does not follow conventions.
00685    */
00686   protected function parseAnB($rule) {
00687     if ($rule == 'even') {
00688       return array(2, 0);
00689     }
00690     elseif ($rule == 'odd') {
00691       return array(2, 1);
00692     }
00693     elseif ($rule == 'n') {
00694       return array(1, 0);
00695     }
00696     elseif (is_numeric($rule)) {
00697       return array(0, (int)$rule);
00698     }
00699     
00700     $rule = explode('n', $rule);
00701     if (count($rule) == 0) {
00702       throw new CssParseException("nth-child value is invalid.");
00703     }
00704     
00705     // Each of these is legal: 1, -1, and -. '-' is shorthand for -1.
00706     $aVal = trim($rule[0]);
00707     $aVal = ($aVal == '-') ? -1 : (int)$aVal;
00708     
00709     $bVal = !empty($rule[1]) ? (int)trim($rule[1]) : 0;
00710     return array($aVal, $bVal);
00711   }
00712   
00713   /**
00714    * Pseudo-class handler for nth-child and all related pseudo-classes.
00715    *
00716    * @param int $groupSize
00717    *  The size of the group (in an+b, this is a).
00718    * @param int $elementInGroup 
00719    *  The offset in a group. (in an+b this is b).
00720    * @param boolean $lastChild
00721    *  Whether counting should begin with the last child. By default, this is false.
00722    *  Pseudo-classes that start with the last-child can set this to true.
00723    */
00724   protected function nthChild($groupSize, $elementInGroup, $lastChild = FALSE) {
00725     // EXPERIMENTAL: New in Quark. This should be substantially faster 
00726     // than the old (jQuery-ish) version. It still has E_STRICT violations
00727     // though.
00728     $parents = new SplObjectStorage();
00729     $matches = new SplObjectStorage();
00730     
00731     $i = 0;
00732     foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
00733       $parent = $item->parentNode;
00734       
00735       // Build up an array of all of children of this parent, and store the 
00736       // index of each element for reference later. We only need to do this 
00737       // once per parent, though.
00738       if (!$parents->contains($parent)) {
00739         
00740         $c = 0;
00741         foreach ($parent->childNodes as $child) {
00742           // We only want nodes, and if this call is preceded by an element 
00743           // selector, we only want to match elements with the same tag name.
00744           // !!! This last part is a grey area in the CSS 3 Selector spec. It seems
00745           // necessary to make the implementation match the examples in the spec. However,
00746           // jQuery 1.2 does not do this.
00747           if ($child->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && ($this->findAnyElement || $child->tagName == $item->tagName)) {
00748             // This may break E_STRICT.
00749             $child->nodeIndex = ++$c;
00750           }
00751         }
00752         // This may break E_STRICT.
00753         $parent->numElements = $c;
00754         $parents->attach($parent);
00755       }
00756       
00757       // If we are looking for the last child, we count from the end of a list.
00758       // Note that we add 1 because CSS indices begin at 1, not 0.
00759       if ($lastChild) {
00760         $indexToMatch = $item->parentNode->numElements  - $item->nodeIndex + 1;
00761       }
00762       // Otherwise we count from the beginning of the list.
00763       else {
00764         $indexToMatch = $item->nodeIndex;
00765       }
00766       
00767       // If group size is 0, then we return element at the right index.
00768       if ($groupSize == 0) {
00769         if ($indexToMatch == $elementInGroup) 
00770           $matches->attach($item);
00771       }
00772       // If group size != 0, then we grab nth element from group offset by
00773       // element in group.
00774       else {
00775         if (($indexToMatch - $elementInGroup) % $groupSize == 0 
00776             && ($indexToMatch - $elementInGroup) / $groupSize >= 0) {
00777           $matches->attach($item);
00778         }
00779       }
00780       
00781       // Iterate.
00782       ++$i;
00783     }
00784     $this->matches = $matches;
00785   }
00786   
00787   /**
00788    * Reverse a set of matches.
00789    *
00790    * This is now necessary because internal matches are no longer represented
00791    * as arrays.
00792    * @since QueryPath 2.0
00793    *//*
00794   private function reverseMatches() {
00795     // Reverse the candidate list. There must be a better way of doing
00796     // this.
00797     $arr = array();
00798     foreach ($this->matches as $m) array_unshift($arr, $m);
00799     
00800     $this->found = new SplObjectStorage();
00801     foreach ($arr as $item) $this->found->attach($item);
00802   }*/
00803   
00804   /**
00805    * Pseudo-class handler for :nth-last-child and related pseudo-classes.
00806    */
00807   protected function nthLastChild($groupSize, $elementInGroup) {
00808     // New in Quark.
00809     $this->nthChild($groupSize, $elementInGroup, TRUE);
00810   }
00811   
00812   /**
00813    * Get a list of peer elements.
00814    * If $requireSameTag is TRUE, then only peer elements with the same
00815    * tagname as the given element will be returned.
00816    *
00817    * @param $element
00818    *  A DomElement.
00819    * @param $requireSameTag
00820    *  Boolean flag indicating whether all matches should have the same
00821    *  element name (tagName) as $element.
00822    * @return
00823    *  Array of peer elements.
00824    *//*
00825   protected function listPeerElements($element, $requireSameTag = FALSE) {
00826     $peers = array();
00827     $parent = $element->parentNode;
00828     foreach ($parent->childNodes as $node) {
00829       if ($node->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
00830         if ($requireSameTag) {
00831           // Need to make sure that the tag matches:
00832           if ($element->tagName == $node->tagName) {
00833             $peers[] = $node;
00834           }
00835         }
00836         else {
00837           $peers[] = $node;
00838         }
00839       }
00840     }
00841     return $peers;
00842   }
00843   */
00844   /**

00910   /**
00911    * Pseudo-class handler for nth-of-type-child.
00912    * Not implemented.
00913    */
00914   protected function nthOfTypeChild($groupSize, $elementInGroup, $lastChild) {
00915     // EXPERIMENTAL: New in Quark. This should be substantially faster 
00916     // than the old (jQuery-ish) version. It still has E_STRICT violations
00917     // though.
00918     $parents = new SplObjectStorage();
00919     $matches = new SplObjectStorage();
00920     
00921     $i = 0;
00922     foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
00923       $parent = $item->parentNode;
00924       
00925       // Build up an array of all of children of this parent, and store the 
00926       // index of each element for reference later. We only need to do this 
00927       // once per parent, though.
00928       if (!$parents->contains($parent)) {
00929         
00930         $c = 0;
00931         foreach ($parent->childNodes as $child) {
00932           // This doesn't totally make sense, since the CSS 3 spec does not require that
00933           // this pseudo-class be adjoined to an element (e.g. ' :nth-of-type' is allowed).
00934           if ($child->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && $child->tagName == $item->tagName) {
00935             // This may break E_STRICT.
00936             $child->nodeIndex = ++$c;
00937           }
00938         }
00939         // This may break E_STRICT.
00940         $parent->numElements = $c;
00941         $parents->attach($parent);
00942       }
00943       
00944       // If we are looking for the last child, we count from the end of a list.
00945       // Note that we add 1 because CSS indices begin at 1, not 0.
00946       if ($lastChild) {
00947         $indexToMatch = $item->parentNode->numElements  - $item->nodeIndex + 1;
00948       }
00949       // Otherwise we count from the beginning of the list.
00950       else {
00951         $indexToMatch = $item->nodeIndex;
00952       }
00953       
00954       // If group size is 0, then we return element at the right index.
00955       if ($groupSize == 0) {
00956         if ($indexToMatch == $elementInGroup) 
00957           $matches->attach($item);
00958       }
00959       // If group size != 0, then we grab nth element from group offset by
00960       // element in group.
00961       else {
00962         if (($indexToMatch - $elementInGroup) % $groupSize == 0 
00963             && ($indexToMatch - $elementInGroup) / $groupSize >= 0) {
00964           $matches->attach($item);
00965         }
00966       }
00967       
00968       // Iterate.
00969       ++$i;
00970     }
00971     $this->matches = $matches;
00972   }

00974   /**
00975    * Pseudo-class handler for nth-last-of-type-child.
00976    * Not implemented.

00978   protected function nthLastOfTypeChild($groupSize, $elementInGroup) {
00979     $this->nthOfTypeChild($groupSize, $elementInGroup, TRUE);    
00980   }
00981   
00982   /**
00983    * Pseudo-class handler for :lang
00984    */
00985   protected function lang($value) {
00986     // TODO: This checks for cases where an explicit language is
00987     // set. The spec seems to indicate that an element should inherit
00988     // language from the parent... but this is unclear.
00989     $operator = (strpos($value, '-') !== FALSE) ? self::isExactly : self::containsWithHyphen;
00990     
00991     $orig = $this->matches;
00992     $origDepth = $this->findAnyElement;
00993     
00994     // Do first pass: attributes in default namespace
00995     $this->attribute('lang', $value, $operator);
00996     $lang = $this->matches; // Temp array for merging.
00997     
00998     // Reset
00999     $this->matches = $orig;
01000     $this->findAnyElement = $origDepth;
01001     
01002     // Do second pass: attributes in 'xml' namespace.
01003     $this->attributeNS('lang', 'xml', $value, $operator);
01004     
01005     
01006     // Merge results. 
01007     // FIXME: Note that we lose natural ordering in
01008     // the document because we search for xml:lang separately
01009     // from lang.
01010     foreach ($this->matches as $added) $lang->attach($added);
01011     $this->matches = $lang;
01012   }
01013   
01014   /**
01015    * Pseudo-class handler for :not(filter).
01016    *
01017    * This does not follow the specification in the following way: The CSS 3
01018    * selector spec says the value of not() must be a simple selector. This
01019    * function allows complex selectors.
01020    *
01021    * @param string $filter
01022    *  A CSS selector.
01023    */
01024   protected function not($filter) {
01025     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01026     //$found = array();
01027     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01028     foreach ($matches as $item) {
01029       $handler = new QueryPathCssEventHandler($item);
01030       $not_these = $handler->find($filter)->getMatches();
01031       if ($not_these->count() == 0) {
01032         $found->attach($item);
01033       }
01034     }
01035     // No need to check for unique elements, since the list
01036     // we began from already had no duplicates.
01037     $this->matches = $found;    
01038   }
01039   
01040   /**
01041    * Pseudo-class handler for :has(filter).
01042    * This can also be used as a general filtering routine.
01043    */
01044   public function has($filter) {
01045     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01046     //$found = array();
01047     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01048     foreach ($matches as $item) {
01049       $handler = new QueryPathCssEventHandler($item);
01050       $these = $handler->find($filter)->getMatches();
01051       if (count($these) > 0) {
01052         $found->attach($item);
01053       }      
01054     }
01055     $this->matches = $found;
01056     return $this;
01057   }
01058   
01059   /**
01060    * Pseudo-class handler for :first-of-type.
01061    */
01062   protected function firstOfType() {
01063     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01064     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01065     foreach ($matches as $item) {
01066       $type = $item->tagName;
01067       $parent = $item->parentNode;
01068       foreach ($parent->childNodes as $kid) {
01069         if ($kid->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && $kid->tagName == $type) {
01070           if (!$found->contains($kid)) {
01071             $found->attach($kid);
01072           }
01073           break;
01074         }
01075       }
01076     }
01077     $this->matches = $found;
01078   }
01079   
01080   /**
01081    * Pseudo-class handler for :last-of-type.
01082    */
01083   protected function lastOfType() {
01084     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01085     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01086     foreach ($matches as $item) {
01087       $type = $item->tagName;
01088       $parent = $item->parentNode;
01089       for ($i = $parent->childNodes->length - 1; $i >= 0; --$i) {
01090         $kid = $parent->childNodes->item($i);
01091         if ($kid->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && $kid->tagName == $type) {
01092           if (!$found->contains($kid)) {
01093             $found->attach($kid);
01094           }
01095           break;
01096         }
01097       }
01098     }
01099     $this->matches = $found;
01100   }
01101   
01102   /**
01103    * Pseudo-class handler for :only-child.
01104    */
01105   protected function onlyChild() {
01106     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01107     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01108     foreach($matches as $item) {
01109       $parent = $item->parentNode;
01110       $kids = array();
01111       foreach($parent->childNodes as $kid) {
01112         if ($kid->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
01113           $kids[] = $kid;
01114         }
01115       }
01116       // There should be only one child element, and
01117       // it should be the one being tested.
01118       if (count($kids) == 1 && $kids[0] === $item) {
01119         $found->attach($kids[0]);
01120       }
01121     }
01122     $this->matches = $found;
01123   }
01124   
01125   /**
01126    * Pseudo-class handler for :empty.
01127    */
01128   protected function emptyElement() {
01129     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01130     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01131     foreach ($matches as $item) {
01132       $empty = TRUE;
01133       foreach($item->childNodes as $kid) {
01134         // From the spec: Elements and Text nodes are the only ones to
01135         // affect emptiness.
01136         if ($kid->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE || $kid->nodeType == XML_TEXT_NODE) {
01137           $empty = FALSE;
01138           break;
01139         }
01140       }
01141       if ($empty) {
01142         $found->attach($item);
01143       }
01144     }
01145     $this->matches = $found;
01146   }
01147   
01148   /**
01149    * Pseudo-class handler for :only-of-type.
01150    */
01151   protected function onlyOfType() {
01152     $matches = $this->candidateList();
01153     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01154     foreach ($matches as $item) {
01155       if (!$item->parentNode) {
01156         $this->matches = new SplObjectStorage();
01157       }
01158       $parent = $item->parentNode;
01159       $onlyOfType = TRUE;
01160       
01161       // See if any peers are of the same type
01162       foreach($parent->childNodes as $kid) {
01163         if ($kid->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE 
01164             && $kid->tagName == $item->tagName 
01165             && $kid !== $item) {
01166           //$this->matches = new SplObjectStorage();
01167           $onlyOfType = FALSE;
01168           break;
01169         }
01170       }
01171       
01172       // If no others were found, attach this one.
01173       if ($onlyOfType) $found->attach($item);
01174     }
01175     $this->matches = $found;
01176   }
01177   
01178   /**
01179    * Check for attr value matches based on an operation.
01180    */
01181   protected function attrValMatches($needle, $haystack, $operation) {
01182     
01183     if (strlen($haystack) < strlen($needle)) return FALSE;
01184     
01185     // According to the spec:  
01186     // "The case-sensitivity of attribute names in selectors depends on the document language."
01187     // (6.3.2)
01188     // To which I say, "huh?". We assume case sensitivity.
01189     switch ($operation) {
01190       case CssEventHandler::isExactly:
01191         return $needle == $haystack;
01192       case CssEventHandler::containsWithSpace:
01193         return in_array($needle, explode(' ', $haystack));
01194       case CssEventHandler::containsWithHyphen:
01195         return in_array($needle, explode('-', $haystack));
01196       case CssEventHandler::containsInString:
01197         return strpos($haystack, $needle) !== FALSE;
01198       case CssEventHandler::beginsWith:
01199         return strpos($haystack, $needle) === 0;
01200       case CssEventHandler::endsWith:
01201         //return strrpos($haystack, $needle) === strlen($needle) - 1;
01202         return preg_match('/' . $needle . '$/', $haystack) == 1;
01203     }
01204     return FALSE; // Shouldn't be able to get here.
01205   }
01206   
01207   /**
01208    * As the spec mentions, these must be at the end of a selector or
01209    * else they will cause errors. Most selectors return elements. Pseudo-elements
01210    * do not.
01211    */
01212   public function pseudoElement($name) {
01213     // process the pseudoElement
01214     switch ($name) {
01215       // XXX: Should this return an array -- first line of 
01216       // each of the matched elements?
01217       case 'first-line':
01218         $matches = $this->candidateList();
01219         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01220         $o = new stdClass();
01221         foreach ($matches as $item) {
01222           $str = $item->textContent;
01223           $lines = explode("\n", $str);
01224           if (!empty($lines)) {
01225             $line = trim($lines[0]);
01226             if (!empty($line))
01227               $o->textContent = $line;
01228               $found->attach($o);//trim($lines[0]);
01229           }
01230         }
01231         $this->matches = $found;
01232         break;
01233       // XXX: Should this return an array -- first letter of each
01234       // of the matched elements?
01235       case 'first-letter':
01236         $matches = $this->candidateList();
01237         $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01238         $o = new stdClass();
01239         foreach ($matches as $item) {
01240           $str = $item->textContent;
01241           if (!empty($str)) {
01242             $str = substr($str,0, 1);
01243             $o->textContent = $str;
01244             $found->attach($o);
01245           }
01246         }
01247         $this->matches = $found;
01248         break;
01249       case 'before':
01250       case 'after':
01251         // There is nothing in a DOM to return for the before and after 
01252         // selectors.
01253       case 'selection':
01254         // With no user agent, we don't have a concept of user selection.
01255         throw new NotImplementedException("The $name pseudo-element is not implemented.");
01256         break;
01257     }
01258     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;  
01259   }
01260   public function directDescendant() {
01261     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
01262         
01263     $kids = new SplObjectStorage();
01264     foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
01265       $kidsNL = $item->childNodes;
01266       foreach ($kidsNL as $kidNode) {
01267         if ($kidNode->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
01268           $kids->attach($kidNode);
01269         }
01270       }
01271     }
01272     $this->matches = $kids;
01273   }
01274   /**
01275    * For an element to be adjacent to another, it must be THE NEXT NODE
01276    * in the node list. So if an element is surrounded by pcdata, there are
01277    * no adjacent nodes. E.g. in <a/>FOO<b/>, the a and b elements are not 
01278    * adjacent.
01279    *
01280    * In a strict DOM parser, line breaks and empty spaces are nodes. That means
01281    * nodes like this will not be adjacent: <test/> <test/>. The space between
01282    * them makes them non-adjacent. If this is not the desired behavior, pass
01283    * in the appropriate flags to your parser. Example:
01284    * <code>
01285    * $doc = new DomDocument();
01286    * $doc->loadXML('<test/> <test/>', LIBXML_NOBLANKS);
01287    * </code>
01288    */
01289   public function adjacent() {
01290     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
01291     // List of nodes that are immediately adjacent to the current one.
01292     //$found = array();
01293     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01294     foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
01295       while (isset($item->nextSibling)) {
01296         if (isset($item->nextSibling) && $item->nextSibling->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
01297           $found->attach($item->nextSibling);
01298           break;
01299         }
01300         $item = $item->nextSibling;
01301       }
01302     }
01303     $this->matches = $found;
01304   }
01305   
01306   public function anotherSelector() {
01307     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
01308     // Copy old matches into buffer.
01309     if ($this->matches->count() > 0) {
01310       //$this->alreadyMatched = array_merge($this->alreadyMatched, $this->matches);
01311       foreach ($this->matches as $item) $this->alreadyMatched->attach($item);
01312     }
01313     
01314     // Start over at the top of the tree.
01315     $this->findAnyElement = TRUE; // Reset depth flag.
01316     $this->matches = new SplObjectStorage();
01317     $this->matches->attach($this->dom);
01318   }
01319   
01320   /**
01321    * Get all nodes that are siblings to currently selected nodes.
01322    *
01323    * If two passed in items are siblings of each other, neither will
01324    * be included in the list of siblings. Their status as being candidates
01325    * excludes them from being considered siblings.
01326    */
01327   public function sibling() {
01328     $this->findAnyElement = FALSE;
01329     // Get the nodes at the same level.
01330     
01331     if ($this->matches->count() > 0) {
01332       $sibs = new SplObjectStorage();
01333       foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
01334         /*$candidates = $item->parentNode->childNodes;
01335         foreach ($candidates as $candidate) {
01336           if ($candidate->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE && $candidate !== $item) {
01337             $sibs->attach($candidate);
01338           }
01339         }
01340         */
01341         while ($item->nextSibling != NULL) {
01342           $item = $item->nextSibling;
01343           if ($item->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) $sibs->attach($item);
01344         }
01345       }
01346       $this->matches = $sibs;
01347     }
01348   }
01349   
01350   /**
01351    * Get any descendant.
01352    */
01353   public function anyDescendant() {
01354     // Get children:
01355     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01356     foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
01357       $kids = $item->getElementsByTagName('*');
01358       //$found = array_merge($found, $this->nodeListToArray($kids));
01359       $this->attachNodeList($kids, $found);
01360     }
01361     $this->matches = $found;
01362     
01363     // Set depth flag:
01364     $this->findAnyElement = TRUE;
01365   }
01366   
01367   /**
01368    * Determine what candidates are in the current scope.
01369    *
01370    * This is a utility method that gets the list of elements
01371    * that should be evaluated in the context. If $this->findAnyElement
01372    * is TRUE, this will return a list of every element that appears in
01373    * the subtree of $this->matches. Otherwise, it will just return 
01374    * $this->matches.
01375    */
01376   private function candidateList() {
01377     if ($this->findAnyElement) {
01378       return $this->getAllCandidates($this->matches);
01379     }
01380     return $this->matches;
01381   }
01382   
01383   /**
01384    * Get a list of all of the candidate elements.
01385    *
01386    * This is used when $this->findAnyElement is TRUE.
01387    * @param $elements
01388    *  A list of current elements (usually $this->matches).
01389    *
01390    * @return 
01391    *  A list of all candidate elements.
01392    */
01393   private function getAllCandidates($elements) {
01394     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
01395     foreach ($elements as $item) {
01396       $found->attach($item); // put self in
01397       $nl = $item->getElementsByTagName('*');
01398       //foreach ($nl as $node) $found[] = $node;
01399       $this->attachNodeList($nl, $found);
01400     }
01401     return $found;
01402   }
01403   /*
01404   public function nodeListToArray($nodeList) {
01405     $array = array();
01406     foreach ($nodeList as $node) {
01407       if ($node->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
01408         $array[] = $node;
01409       }
01410     }
01411     return $array;
01412   }
01413   */
01414   
01415   /**
01416    * Attach all nodes in a node list to the given SplObjectStorage.
01417    */
01418   public function attachNodeList(DOMNodeList $nodeList, SplObjectStorage $splos) {
01419     foreach ($nodeList as $item) $splos->attach($item);
01420   }
01421   
01422 }
01423 
01424 /**
01425  * Exception thrown for unimplemented CSS.
01426  *
01427  * This is thrown in cases where some feature is expected, but the current 
01428  * implementation does not support that feature.
01429  *
01430  * @ingroup querypath_css
01431  */
01432 class NotImplementedException extends Exception {}
